intro: Homoglossum huttonii, commonly known as the Hutton's homoglossum, is a rare flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its distinctive bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in a fine, silky hair. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Homoglossum huttonii is considered a vulnerable species.
